sen.j: 晴明神社（せいめいじんじゃ）は、京都市上京区にある神社である。
sen.e: The Seimei-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine in Kamigyo Ward of Kyoto City.
The Seimei-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine in Kamigyo Ward of Kyoto City.
The Seimei-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine in Kamigyo Ward of Kyoto City.

sen.j: 安倍晴明を祀る。
sen.e: It's dedicated to Abe no Seimei.
It's dedicated to Seimei ABE.
sen.cmt: 姓と名の順番をかえる。「アベノ」の｢ノ」は不要と判断。
sen.e: It's dedicated to Seimei ABE.

sen.j: 一条戻橋のたもと（北西）にあった晴明の屋敷跡に鎮座する。
sen.e: It's located at the site of his premises, which once existed near (northwest of) the Ichijo Modori-bashi.
It's located at the site of his premises, which once existed near (northwest of) the Ichijo Modori-bashi.
It's located at the site of his premises, which once existed near (northwest of) the Ichijo Modori-bashi.

sen.j: 全国各地に同名の神社が存在する。
sen.e: There are many shrines nationwide with the same name.
There are many shrines nationwide with the same name.
There are many shrines nationwide with the same name.

sen.j: 寛弘2年（1005年）に晴明が亡くなると、時の一条天皇は晴明の遺業を賛え、晴明は稲荷神の生まれ変わりであるとして、寛弘4年（1007年）、その屋敷跡に晴明を祀る神社を創建した。
sen.e: When Seimei died in Kankou 2 (A.D.1005), the then Emperor Ichijyo admired his work, called him the reincarnation of Inari, and raised the shrine dedicated to Seimei at the site of his residence in Kankou 4 (A.D.1007).
When Seimei died in 1005, the then Emperor Ichijyo admired his work, called him the reincarnation of Inari god, and raised the shrine dedicated to him at the site of his residence in 1007.
sen.cmt: 西洋暦のみを使用。稲荷神の「神」を追加。
sen.e: When Seimei died in 1005, Ichijyo, the Emperor of the time, admired his work and called him the reincarnation of Inari the god. A shrine was built and dedicated to him at the site of his premises in 1007.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 当地の社地は広大なものであったが、戦火や豊臣秀吉の都市整備などにより次第に縮小し、社殿も荒れたままの状態となった。
sen.e: The shrine's area here was large at first, but gradually shrinked through events like wars and the urban improvement by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, and the shrine's buildings were left decayed.
The shrine's area was large at first, but gradually shrank through events like wars and the urban improvement by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, and its buildings were left decayed.
The area of the shrine was large at first but gradually diminished through events like wars and the urban improvement by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI and its buildings were left decayed.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 幕末以降、氏子らが中心となって社殿・境内の整備が行われ、昭和25年（1950年）には堀川通に面するように境内地が拡張された。
sen.e: From the last days of the Tokugawa shogunate, the shrine's buildings and precincts got repair funded mainly by the shrine parishioners, and in Showa 25 (A.D.1950), the shrine's area was enlarged to face the Horikawa-dori.

From the last days of the Tokugawa shogunate, the shrine's buildings and precincts were repaired by the fund raised mainly by the shrine parishioners, and in 1950, the shrine's area was enlarged to face the Horikawa-dori street.

From the last days of the Tugawa shogunate, the shrine's buildings and precincts were repaired by funds raised mainly by the shrine parishioners. In 1950, the shrine's area was changed to face Horikawa street.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 平成以降、安倍晴明のブームが起こり、全国から参拝者が訪れるようになった。
sen.e: During this Heisei era, Abe no Seimei became quite popular and worshipers have come to visit the shrine from all over the country.
During the Heisei era, Seimei ABE became extremely popular and worshipers have come to visit the shrine from all over the country.
sen.cmt: 安倍晴明の表記を修正。
sen.e: During the Heisei era, Seimei ABE became extremely popular and worshipers have come to visit the shrine from all over the country.

sen.j: 晴明歿後千年となる平成17年（2005年）には安倍晴明千年祭が行われた。
sen.e: The millenial commemoration for Abe no Seimei took place in Heisei 17 (A.D.2005), when just a thousand years passed from his death.
The millennium commemoration for Seimei ABE was held in 2005, when a thousand years had passed since his death.
The millennium commemoration for Seimei ABE was held in 2005, when a thousand years had passed since his death.

sen.j: 1月1日：新年祭
sen.e: Janually 1 : the New Year Festival
Janually 1 : the New Year Festival
Janually 1 : the New Year Festival

sen.j: 2月節分：節分星祭
sen.e: February 3 : the Setsubun Star Festival
February, Setsubun day : the Setsubun Star Festival
sen.cmt: 節分の日にちは毎年変わるので、3日と特定しない方がよい。
sen.e: February, Setsubun day : the Setsubun Star Festival

sen.j: 6月26日：火災除祈願祭
sen.e: June 26 : the Pray-No-Fire Festival
June 26 : the Pray-No-Fire Festival
June 26 : the Pray-No-Fire Festival

sen.j: 9月秋分日：晴明祭
sen.e: September 23 : the Seimei Festival
September, Syubun day : the Seimei Festival
sen.cmt: 秋分の日にちも毎年変わるので、特定しない方がよい。
sen.e: September, Syubun (Autumnal Equinox) day : the Seimei Festival
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 前日：宵宮祭
sen.e: The previous date : the Yoimiya Festival
The previous date : the Yoimiya Festival
The previous date : the Yoimiya Festival

sen.j: 当日：例祭、神幸祭
sen.e: September 23 : the Rei Festival, the Shinkou Festival
Syubun day: the Rei Festival, the Shinkou Festival
Syubun day: the Rei Festival, the Shinkou Festival

sen.j: 9月26日：嵯峨墓所祭
sen.e: September 26 : the Saga Grave Anniversary
September 26 : the Saga Grave Anniversary
September 26 : the Saga Grave Anniversary

sen.j: 11月23日：御火焚祭
sen.e: Nobember 23 : the Ohitaki Festival
November 23 : the Ohitaki Festival
November 23 : the Ohitaki Festival

sen.j: （三社合祀）：斎稲荷社・天満社・地主社
sen.e: (Three shrines deified together) : Itsuki Inari Shrine, Tenman Shrine, and Jinushi Shrine
(Three shrines deified together) : Itsuki Inari Shrine, Tenman Shrine, and Jinushi Shrine
(Three shrines deified together) : Itsuki Inari Shrine, Tenman Shrine, and Jinushi Shrine

sen.j: その他
sen.e: Others
Others
Others

sen.j: 「名づけの神様」として、市内の人々が赤ん坊の名前を付けてもらいに参拝することがある。
sen.e: Seimei has also been worshipped as "God of name-giver", so some residents in Kyoto City visit and ask the shrine to name their babies.
Seimei has also been worshipped as "God of name-giver", so some residents in Kyoto City visit and ask the shrine to name their babies.
Seimei has also been worshipped as "God of name-giver", so some residents in Kyoto City visit and ask the shrine to name their babies.

sen.j: （事前に命名候補を幾つか用意し、その中から神主に陰陽五行に基づき選んでもらう。
sen.e: (Inform several candidates beforehand, and the shrine's Shinto priest will select the best name among them on the basis of Wu Xing of yin and yang.
(Inform several candidates beforehand, and the shrine's Shinto priest will select the best name among them on the basis of Wu Xing of yin and yang.
(Inform several candidates beforehand, and the shrine's Shinto priest will select the best name among them on the basis of Yin-Yang and the five elements.

sen.j: もしくは両親が選ぶ。）
sen.e: Or parents themselves select in consultation with the priest.
Or parents themselves select in consultation with the priest.)
Or parents themselves select in consultation with the priest.)

sen.j: 最寄バス停：京都駅より京都市バス9系統 一条戻り橋下車
sen.e: The nearest bus stop : When you are at Kyoto Station, please get on the Kyoto City Bus, whose scheme number is 9, and get off at Ichijyo Modori-bashi.
The nearest bus stop : When you are at Kyoto Station, please get on the Kyoto City Bus No. 9, and get off at Ichijyo Modori-bashi.
The nearest bus stop : When you are at Kyoto Station, please get on the Kyoto City Bus No. 9, and get off at Ichijyo Modori-bashi.

sen.j: 京阪四条駅・阪急河原町・烏丸駅より京都市バス12系統 同下車
sen.e: When you are at Keihan Shijyo Station, Hankyu Kawaramachi Station, or Karasuma Station, please get on the Kyoto City Bus, whose scheme number is 12, and get off at Ichijyo Modori-bashi.
When you are at Keihan Shijyo Station, Hankyu Kawaramachi Station, or Karasuma Station, please get on the Kyoto City Bus No. 12, and get off at Ichijyo Modori-bashi.
When you are at Keihan Shijyo Station, Hankyu Kawaramachi Station, or Karasuma Station, please get on the Kyoto City Bus No. 12, and get off at Ichijyo Modori-bashi.

sen.j: 駐車場：あり（有料）100円/20分
sen.e: A parking lot : available (a must-pay) at 100 yen per 20 minutes
A parking lot : available (100 yen charge per 20 minutes)
